115122.content:
You decide that jumping on Twilight’s book is the best way to grab her attention. Whatever is going on with you, the princess of friendship is surely your best source for help. As you make your way towards the lavender alicorn, you are awestruck by how big she seems from your perspective. You are barely the height of her hoof.

She fortunately stops roaming about and sets the book in her telekinetic grip on the floor to search the shelves for another. Hoisting yourself on the open pages, you look up and wave your arms about to catch her attention. She pulls out a book from the shelf and turns back to the one you are standing on.

Unfortunately, when she notices you, her eyes widen in shock and the magical grip holding the second book is interrupted. The heavy object comes hurtling down towards you and you do not even have time to realize your peril. Alas, luck is on your side and the book slams an inch away from you. However, the force is enough to knock you over. Before you can recover, you feel a warm sensation envelop you and you find yourself ascending at a dizzying rate. When your vision clears, you are hovering in front of the inquisitive purple iris of Twilight Sparkle.

“I don’t believe it,” her booming voice remarks as a gust of warm equine breath blows over you. At noticing you cringe, she apologetically distances you from her face and lowers her tone. “I’m sorry, little guy. This must be terrifying for you. Here, let’s go to my bedchamber. It’s much more cosy there.”
By the time the two of you reach her bedchamber, Twilight had managed calm you down and break the ice with introductions. The room was indeed a lot cosier than the castle halls with carpets, curtains and of course – a bed. Twilight set you down on a silk pillow on the bed and smiled.

“Tea to warm you up?” she suggested. How could you refuse?

**(


A good amount of time later, the two of you are chatting and laughing. Twilight had broken out a bottle of something stronger to lighten the mood and the two of you were relaxing on her bed while slightly tipsy. Twilight had been inquisitive about you and your life, bombarding you with human related questions. With her thirst for knowledge satiated for the time being, the two if you sit in a momentary silence as you finish your drinks. You swirl the red liquor in the glass Twilight had appropriately sized for you before downing the last of it, cringing slightly at the burn in your throat. Twilight does the same before grabbing the glass from you and growing it back to size. As she is corking the bottle you ponder about her display of size alteration.

“I don’t suppose you could grow me back to size?”

Twilight shook her head. “I’m afraid altering living things is not as simple as inanimate objects. It is possible, but I would require help from an equally skilled unicorn like my friend Starlight Glimmer. Being quite ritualistic in nature, the process requires intensive study and a considerable amount of time too.”
You pull a grim face. It is clear that you will have to accept your current predicament for the time being. Twilight leans in and nuzzles you affectionately.

“Besides, why would you want to grow big again. You are so adorable like that. Ponies would pay good money for a pet like yourself. Or maybe I’ll just keep you myself. You know, I even have the perfect cage for you.”
Twilight’s words disturb you. Rising to your feet, you cautiously back away from the giant unicorn. In response she lights up her horn and the now familiar sensation of her magic lifts you in the air.

“All the things I could do with you,” she mused as she brought you to her lips and planted a wet kiss on your face. “Nopony would ever know...”

Her liquor-laced breath is warm and moist. She runs her tongue over her lips to collect your taste, then bites her lip as she ponders what to do with you.

12223.content:
Remain quiet and hidden, little one. I do not wish for 'Tia to know of you just yet." Luna whispers as she trots down the hall. "Once breakfast is done, the fun can begin."

You nod and lie low, not questioning the secrecy for now.

It's a short walk to where the Princesses are having breakfast that morning. From within Luna's mane, it looked like a high tower with a glass ceiling and wall-covering windows to let in sunlight. The floors were polished tile--it must have been a study or outlook they used for private dining. A table was set, with Celestia already seated.

"Ah, Luna! Good to see you so early. Sit down--it's all freshly cooked!"

"Isn't it always, 'Tia?" Luna quipped taking her seat. "I would hope you didn't bring out leftovers."

Celestia playfully stuck out her tongue before eating a strawberry. "Are you still tinkering with that spell, Luna? You've been cooped up in your workshop these past few weeks, pouring over notes and scrolls...you'll beat Twilight's record for time in the library in a few months if you keep this up." She giggled. "You're in a good mood today. Did you make it work?"

So Luna had been trying to 'get a toy', as she put it, for some time? Interesting. Maybe it wasn't just an ordinary teleportation spell she used...

"We made a breakthrough last night," Luna said. You could hear her grin on her voice. It quickly rose to a giddy cheer. "Just for a moment, We felt the magic connect to...something, somewhere; not in Equestria. For a second, We had it!" She pumps a hoof in the air and cheers, and you have to grab onto her mane when she throws her head back and laughs in triumph. "Victory was Ours!"

"Hm. So THAT'S what that 'Eureka'! shout that woke up everypony for five kilometers was about," Celestia mused around a sip of coffee.

"Alas, no little toy from beyond Our world appeared," Luna finished, "but the concept is proven. It seems Starswirl was correct--when Princess Platinum created her 'Find-Me-A-Toy-Nopony-Else-Can-Ever-Have" Spell as a filly, she found a way to reach dimensions beyond ours. On the next casting, We shall have success at last!"

"I'll be sure to tell him the next time the Pillars visit." Celestia sniffed, her tone sounding worried. "Still...I hope whatever creature the spell snaps up can adjust to its new home here. Platinum could be spiteful as a filly, taking what she wanted by force...she so regretted it after her heart warmed."

"Sister, I promise that whatever little toy the spell retrieved will be pampered and adored." A strand of Luna's mane coils around you in a hug. It felt...wonderful. "And, of course, played with. Played with with GREAT enthusiasm."

The sisters chat over breakfast for some time, but you missed most of it. Your fear and confusion from earlier were gone--you were safe, and now knew how you'd gotten to Equestria. By Luna's explanation of the spell, it wasn't even like she'd taken you; more that the magic had snatched you up in a fluke of chance. For now, you could relax.

But as you laid back in her starlit mane, getting hungry from the smell of food, one thought kept coming back.

Why hadn't Luna told Celestia about you?

=====

Luna left the table a few minutes later, excusing herself to check her notes on the spell. She brings a saucer of leftover fruit with her--telling Celestia it was a snack for later, but you knew it was for you. As soon as the door closes, Luna's horn ignites and a dark blue aura spreads across her chamber's walls. The bustling sounds from Canterlot fade, and the shutters draw closed. Gas lamps along the walls light up.

"There. Now we are warded from nosy snoopers. None can see or hear in, nor can we be heard from without." Luna explained with a satisfied nod. She trots to her bed, setting the fruit on a nearby table, and lets you leap onto the bed. "Now, are you well?"

"Yes, Luna--and thank you for giving us some privacy. But something's bothering me: why didn't you tell Celestia the spell worked?"

"We shall tell 'Tia eventually, little one. But for now, We simply want you ALL to ourselves." She giggled and winked at you. "After all, We worked hard to get you: finding young Plantinum's diary scattered throughout the Archives, making sense of a filly's scribbled notes and mana circles; reading her chicken-scratch hornwriting--thank the STARS her penmareship improved as an adult--Ahem. You get the gist. Well, after all that effort it is simply right that We should get first claim to play with you!"

She nuzzles you; at your size it's enough to knock you back on the bed. You playfully try to bat her muzzle away, but she simply presses harder, sinking you into the mattress with more cuddles. "Starting now, in fact. Let's see if you can keep away! We demand snuggles!"

Thus begins the Battle of Cuddles!

Luna pulls back to let you recover, then leans in again--only for you to roll away so she faceplants on the bed. She tries to snuffle you from the side, but you leap to your feet and dodge! "Cease your affection, giant!" you shout in your most heroic voice.

"We want snuggles on our cheeks, Tiny! And what we want, we TAKE!" Smirking, Luna pounces her hooves out to catch you, only for you to duck! "Curse thine agility! Do not defy a giant!" She goes for a diving nuzzle, clipping your shoulder when you try to feint to the left. You're knocked down, but turn the fall into a roll that turns Luna's diving nuzzle into a face full of pillows.

"Thou art slippery, little one!" she growls, spitting out feathers. "But We will not be denied!" Spreading her wings, Luna leaps over you to the other side of the bed, the impact bouncing you high off the mattress. You tumble away from her follow-up midair nuzzle, hitting the ground running to try and hide among the giant pillows.
"Bah! As if that can hide you!" Luna drops to her belly and SLIDES across the bed, her snout aimed right at you.

Just like you'd planned.

Just before you reach the pillows, you leap to the side! If you got it right, Luna would slide right past you and into the wall! It was risky--maybe even dangerous-- but it was your only shot at winning the game of keep-away.

Does the trick work?
12223.title: Battle of the Cuddles!

choices: Luna gets up and peels you off her rear--it's time for your breakfast!
Luna wants to keep sitting on you--not that you mind...
122231.content:
Your timing was perfect.
The jump got you well clear of Luna's sliding form.
In short, you nailed it.

Landing near the edge of the bed, you smugly witness the aftermath.

Luna's look of triumph goes to one of confusion, then panic. She tries to arrest her collision course, to no avail.

"WAAAGH! Curse thine trickery, pferdious tin--"

WHAM! Luna crashes face-first into the pillows...and the wall behind them. The crash pushes the huge bed forward and send pillows flying everywhere. Luna's face flattens against the stone wall, leaving cracks in the masonry. Some of the gas lamps on the walls even shake, their flames flickering.

And you can't stop laughing. Luna pulling her head clear from the wall, eyes spinning and a pillow impaled on her
horn doesn't help. Eventually you have to catch your breath and manage to stop laughing.

"Well, you are cleverer than We counted on. Well done, little one." Luna admits, sounding impressed. She gets off the bed and turns her back to you, collecting the wayward pillows. "However, We still win."

What? But you dodged every nuzzle! How does Luna win?

Luna looks back at you, her affectionate smile suddenly a smirk. "Ah, you haven't figured it out? Very well. We said we would cuddle you against Our cheeks...We never said it was exclusive to Our face."

And with that, she sits on you.

Your yelp of shock is cut off as Luna's ample rump comes down. You vanish completely under her flank, the great weight knocking the wind out of you and flattening you deep into the mattress. Struggling proves useless: your arms and legs are immobilized by Luna's mighty backside, unable to move beyond twitches; all you can see is a mass of soft midnight blue and black fur your yelp had even earned you an open mouth-full of the pressing mass.

Luna chortles from above for a long moment. She was having the time of her (immortal) life. "You played well, but as We said; giants get what they want." She twists her backside on the bed a few times for good measure, her cheeks grinding down. It's rough, but thanks to the soft bed it isn't painful at all. "You are a wonderful find, little one. We are proud to have you to pamper and play with--there are so many fun things We have in mind! And, you are quite a comfy seat cushion, too! Do not be surprised if We sit on you again in the future."

Beneath Luna's soft rump, you smile. Strange as this all was, maybe you could grow to like it.

You both relax, ready for whatever the day brings...
122231.title: Yes! You land clear!

choices: Puts you in a scroll and sends you to Spike and Twilight
1223.content:
You asked where you were, however Celestia didn't seem interested in your question.
"I can't believe my sister used the teleportation spell. She is always doing this" Princess Celestia picks you up and takes you to her bedroom. She then sits down and . . .
1223.title: Celestia had you in front of her

choices: She Leaves You There For Now
12231.content:
You suddenly realize you're floating--and immediately go into panic. There was no ground, you would fall; the floor was a long drop; gravity wasn't working; GRAVITY WASN'T WORKING, WHY WERE YOU FLOATING--

Clank!

The next thing you know, you're face-down on a very solid metal floor. It's a good five minutes before the vertigo subsides and you're able to sit up...and find yourself in a round metal birdcage the size of a small room (at your height of 1 inch, it was probably 10 inches around, give or take) with Celestia looking at you from between the bars with a strange mix of sympathy and impatience.

"Sorry, I guess you're not used to being levitated. Don't worry; the cage is just to keep you safely off the floor. Now, I'll be frank--You aren't the first human Luna has brought here, so I already know what questions you have. I'll save us both some time. My name: Princess Celestia. The pony you saw earlier was Princess Luna, my sister. No, you aren't hallucinating or going insane. Yes, I am real. No; I am NOT an alien who's going to eat you, enslave you, or--ugh--'probe' you. Yes, I am a goddess; No, you have NOT been chosen to be my mortal champion. (And no, my existence does NOT mean your human faiths are untrue.) There, that should cover everything."

Celestia's expression never changed, her voice reeked of boredom and told that she'd had to give that speech more times than she could bare. Seeing the normally regal mare so deadpan was so ridiculous you couldn't resist laughing.

"This has happened before?" you ask, leaning against the cage's bars. "Luna taking humans?" You look around and whistle--from the massive bed decked in white and gold, colorful tapestries the size of buildings (from your scale) hanging off the walls, and luxurious treasures around this giant room, you must be in Celestia's personal chamber. You lean out of the cage and look down to the floor--Celestia was sitting on a plush cushion on the marble floor. You hear the giant mare clear her throat and you look up at her sheepishly.

How long had you been just looking around the room? You smile weakly and wave Celestia on.

"She's done it enough times for the novelty to wear off," Celestia answers with an eyeroll. "I'll confess, I thought it was fun at first, playing with her catches. That 'Cinch' woman was in hysterics; it took her hours to stop squeaking <i>'Giant Demon Horse!'</i>" She chuckles and smirks. You wonder what the alicorns had put Crystal Prep's principal through...

Celestia's smile fell. "But lately? Luna's taken to that spell far too much--almost every day for weeks she's had a new human; it's getting tiresome. I'm going to have words with her about this." She sighed, shaking her head before looking at you, her good mood back. "I apologize for your ordeal, little human. You'll be back on your home world soon; when you return seek out a girl named Sunset Shimmer. She'll explain everything."

Wait. She mentioned Sunset? Celestia must think you were from the "Equestria Girls" world! (It WAS the only "human world" she knew of, so it made sense...)

You tap the cage's bars. "Uh, Princess Celestia? There's something you should know--"

A white hoof comes up and taps your cage, rocking your world and knocking you off your feet. Despite her concerned look Celestia can't help but giggle. "I'm sorry, but it will have to wait. Today will be busy, and I can't sit here and chat...even if you humans make for interesting conversation. There's Luna to deal with, not to mention my schedule--but which to do first?"

How does Celestia proceed?
12231.title: Despite All My Rage I'm Still Just A Rat In A Cage

choices: Maybe you should go to Twilight...
122311.content:
Celestia stood up and put your cage on her back. "I might as well confront Luna about this now, before the day's business starts. There is much to do today, and I can't just leave you to sulk in there alone all day." She takes off at a brisk trot from her chambers and down the hall, passing a few guards and staff along the way. A few raise an eyebrow at seeing a caged, tiny human on Celestia's back, but nobody asks questions.

A short time later, she arrives at black-painted double doors, opening the giant doors with her magic. You find Luna's luxurious private chamber--easily as big as a stadium to you, much like Celestia's--and Luna herself pacing about rifling through papers, a worried and strangely guilty look on her face. She sees Celestia and rushes toward her, relief on her voice.

"Sister, you still have the human! We were worried you had sent them to that other world..." A small stack of parchment covered in complex diagrams and equations floated up, cast in her magic. The ink looked fresh, like Luna had just written them. "There is an urgent matter regarding the human--"

"You've been indulging that spell far too much, Lulu. Snatching these poor humans away to be your playthings...it's happening much too often, even if you do let them go." Celestia cuts in sternly. You see Luna wince. "At first, with the children you brought here, it was innocent--cute, even. You spaced it out, to make each time unique. But soon it was a new confused human every night--I couldn't sleep with the roughhousing you got up to sometimes!"

"Yes, but... the time we took turns sitting on the bank robbers WAS fun," Luna says sheepishly.

"Yes, it was--I'll give you that," Celestia admits, her stern tone breaking into a giggle. The sisters share a laugh, and when Celestia speaks, she's far calmer. "But my point stands: you'll have to stop using that spell completely for a good while--don't worry, you may still visit their dreams, but subtly this time. I'll let you teleport humans here again eventually, but only on occasion. Is that fair?"

Luna sighs, nodding and giving Celestia a nuzzle. "Very well 'Tia, it is reasonable."

"Good. I'll be sending this human home, and taking your notes on the spell--"

"Wait! Do not send them there!" Luna interrupts, her smile gone. She looks at you with a sudden sadness, producing her notes again. "I've discovered something troubling. This human is different than the others we played with, 'Tia. When We cast the spell, the magic felt...different, than previous castings. At first We thought nothing of it. We assumed Our catch was from the world where Sunset Shimmer now lives; that after We had had Our fun, We could simply send them back through the portal like the others. But..." She bit her lip, looking between you and Celestia guiltily.

So that confirmed it: Luna had been snatching humans from the Canterlot High world for some playtime, then sending them back unharmed once she was done. You wondered what Sunset thought of the "Giant Pony Abduction" stories that must have been all over the news in that world.

Celestia's look softens. She nuzzles Luna's head, smiling. "It's alright, Luna. Just tell me."

Luna took a deep breath and looked her sister in the eye. "We were curious about the teleportation spell feeling different. Shortly after you took the human, We tested the spell--not to take anything else, just to examine the flow of the magic." Her expression went dead serious. "Sister, We discovered why the magic felt odd: <i>it went wrong</i>. Through a tiny fluke, the connection established was NOT to Sunset's world." She looks at you, crestfallen. "The human we took are not from that world. This time, without Our intent, the spell reached a world Eqqus* has never known." She slumps, gazing at the floor. "There is no portal or natural link back to that world; no link like the Mirror Portal. Until We can find what went wrong with the spell and duplicate the inadvertent link...the human is trapped here."

....Trapped? You were stuck in a giant-sized Equestria, for who knows how long? Your legs give and you fall on your rear, hitting the metal floor hard enough for it to hurt. No, this was NOT good.

Seeing your distress, Luna hangs her head in shame, not daring to look at Celestia. The two are silent for a moment, Luna staring at the floor while Celestia remains unreadable, eyes flicking between Luna and your cage. After a pause, Celestia smiles and leans down to nuzzle Luna. "What's done is done, Little Sister. There is no need to lament what cannot be changed. Besides, it was an accident--a fluke of magic you couldn't control.

"So, are you <i>sure</i> we should not send them to Sunset? Being around other humans might be easier to adjust to, if their stay here is lengthy."

Luna shakes her head. "No, 'Tia. That would be most unwise."

"Oh?"

"When we examined the spell, we also no shrinking component added to the teleportation, as with bringing humans from the...correct world." Luna gives you an apologetic shrug. "Whatever world or universe our guest hails from is NATURALLY small. They would be as tiny in Sunset's world as here."

The idea of being surrounded by giant high schoolers was...unappealing. To say the ABSOLUTE least. You shake your head fervently, making both mares chuckle.

"Well, I suppose that option is out,"Celestia muses, "But that raises another question, one we must answer quickly--I have a busy day ahead of me, and I'm already behind schedule." Her horn glows and your cage is lifted off her back to the floor, at her and Luna's hooves. They lie on their bellies, one on each side, and lean in close. Having two giant smiling faces so close to you is quite intimidating, and you can't help but scoot back.

"If not in Sunset's, where should they stay?" Celestia asks rhetorically. "With us, perhaps? But after what we learned today..."

"That might be awkward," Luna finishes, smiling guilty and giving you an apologetic look. "But perhaps We should let the human choose? We owe them that courtesy and more, given the circumstances."

She had a point. Celestia evidentiary agreed, looking at you expectantly.

So, who will you stay with?

* Eqqus: My name for the Planet Equestria is on
122311.title: Celestia Confronts Luna Right Away

choices: She Tosses You Into Her Mouth
She makes you massage her hooves
122313.content:
(A/N: Had a sudden urge to write a dominating Celestia for some reason)

Celestia's eye drifts to you...and something in her expression changes. You take a step back against the cage as she looks right at you, a smirk slowly growing on her face.

"Then again, there are some things I've <i>always</i> wanted to try with a human. More, aggressive ways to play with them. Luna admits she wants to try them, too; but she says they're too 'rough'. Too...dangerous." She magics your cage's door open, and you're seized in her magic and rudely yanked out of the cage to float inches before Celestia's smirking face. "But now? A human all to myself? Oh, how can I resist! I hope you can stand some roughhousing, little one!"

She winks and giggles devilishly.
You're too scared to try and protest. What would this titanic Princess do to you!

What does Celestia do?
122313.title: Suddenly, She Gets...Other Ideas

choices: She's careful--you're alive, but end up battered
1223131.content:
Celestia stands up, an idea seeming to come to her. "I know just what to try first. You might even enjoy it. Not as much as I will, though..."

She winks at you, and her magic stops. You fall screaming all the way down--would Celestia just watch you splatter on the floor?! How could she do this; she was supposed to be kind! It was horrible, it--

Flumph!

It takes a moment to realize you're not dead. Then you notice you hadn't slammed into the unforgiving floor, but...Celestia's cushion? You roll over and look up to see the gigantic white alicorn with her back to you, looking over her shoulder with a smirk.

"Like the view?" She quips.

You've barely opened your mouth to answer before Celestia's legs bend and her wide flanks descend. That mare was going to sit on you!

"CELESTIA, WAI--"

WHUMP

Celestia's rear lands on you like a meteor. Her left cheek hits you full force, knocking the wind from your lungs and pressing you deep into the cushion as what feels like hundreds of tons of royal alicorn settles onto your tiny form. You even got an open mouth-full of the crushing white mass, having been shouting when her rump came down. You hear her sigh in bliss above you, then giggle.

And, since Celestia was in excellent shape but also loved packing away cake...her rear was quite soft on top of being large. You felt your body adhering to her cheek--when she stood up, you'd be plastered to her flank like a second cutie mark.

All you could see was white fur; all you felt was pain and weight and a crushing feeling. You thrash as best you can and even try to bite the mighty booty, but all it does is tickle Celestia.

"Fight it, it makes it more fun," she taunts grinding down on you--ratcheting up the pain. "But I'm sure you have a re-BUTT-al for my point! Hehe, I always wanted to make that pun!"

You were helplessly trapped under Celestia's crushing backside with no hope of escape...and now she was throwing out puns, clearly enjoying dominating you.

And in the back of your mind, you remembered Celestia saying how dangerous this was. If she wasn't careful, you could easily die under her rump...
1223131.title: Seat Cushion For A Princess

12231311.content:
It kept up for half an hour. Celestia would wiggle down, taunt you with a rear end pun, bounce up and down on you--all to make you struggle and tickle her flank. Sometimes she's sit still for minutes at a time, simply enjoying the feeling of your tiny form pinned beneath her.

Then, she decided to try something new.

***

Celestia leaned forward, panting and fanning herself. When she'd put more weight down, the human's desperate struggles beneath her rump felt...amazing. The feeling of totally dominating the small being, how each thrash was like a massage for her rear, the muffled yells...it was wonderful.

And of course there was the thought of using her BEHIND to play with the human. It was so childish and even a little perverse, and that made it even more fun! And her flanks were the perfect size for it. She leaned back again and added a few twists of her flanks for good measure, grinding the human beneath her even more. Their struggles grew more frantic than ever, and her face flushed. She laughed. "Oh, a fighter are we?" She taunted, looking down. "Fine. This is our counterpunch!" She slowly leaned back on the cushion, pressing down more and more, more than she ever had until now. Soon, her full weight bore down on the human---

***

The pressure skyrocketed. Agony shot through your body as Celestia's flank bore down harder than ever--this time down to your bones. And the weight was only increasing!

You couldn't move, couldn't scream; everything hurt too much. It was horrible, it was a nightmare, it--

***

*crunch*

Celestia's eyes shot open. She suddenly felt cold, her euphoria gone. The human had suddenly stopped that lovely struggling, and she couldn't really feel their body's imprint on her rump anymore--it was as if the human was suddenly flat.

Oh dear. Did I really...? She stood up and looked at her rear to confirm what she already feared. There was nothing left of the human but a small red stain on her backside--the creature must have popped like a grape once she put her full weight on it.

Celestia felt slightly guilty. She knew full well how dangerous sitting on the human was, and had given little thought to holding back. But she hadn't intended to simply crush the human like that; it was a terribly undignified way to die.

She couldn't help but smile as she took out a piece of cloth and wiped the human's remains off her left cheek.

Oh well. It was fun while it lasted. I may as well tell Luna what happened...she'll be upset about me crushing the human, but once I tell her how--exhilarating--sitting on them is, she'll cheer right up.

Celestia headed for Luna's chambers, humming a happy tune. At some point in her her walk down the hall, she dropped the human-stained cloth down a laundry chute--anypony who saw it would never know why it was bloodied, simply assuming somepony had a nosebleed.

Celestia, for her part, never gave the human she'd crushed like a bug under her sitting rear a second thought.
12231311.title: Bad (Rear) End

choices: Surely it couldn't hurt to have some fun?
Humans have caused enough trouble so best not risk it.
1223132.content:
Celestia levitates you in front of her massive-to-you face with a strange expression. Her eyes study your dimensionally stunted body with never breaking intensity. Then her lips twist into a mischievous smirk.

”Your Highness, could y…”

Your sentence is cut short as Celestia releases an exaggerated sigh, intentionally blasting you with her warm breath. Then, without giving you a chance to recover, the magic holding you jerks you forward right into the princess’s gaping maw. You barely manage to yelp in shock before you smash against her slick tongue and your world goes dark.

What you lack for in sight is more than made up for by your other senses. The tongue you had been set against comes alive. Saying it to be under you would not have been strictly correct – more like around you as the muscle explores your puny form. The air is moist and oppressive as one would expect it to be inside a living being, not that you get much chance to appreciate it thanks to the incessant suckling that your body is being subjected to.

************

Celestia, on the otherhoof, was having the time of her life. The little human was simply the perfect form to tease and suckle upon. That slender and hairless body flattened so nicely between her tongue and palate or rubbed perfectly against her cheek. She could feel the morsel attempt at fighting back, but all that did was encourage her to go as far as to hurt it. It was as if all of her frustrations were pouring out into this bipedal being she held in her mouth.

The princess’s eyes shot open. She abruptly stopped her game. What was she doing? She had not felt this way in… centuries. Equestria had not needed an iron-fisted ruler for so long that she had forgotten her own power. And here she was, engaging in seemingly harmless play, yet it awoke in her a vigour she had suppressed for so long. It felt good.

The human’s squirms snapped her back to reality. Then she remembered that there were places she needed to be. But what to do with the human? It was not here by choice. The right thing to do was to help it return home, but something inside her told her otherwise. Would it be that bad if she saved it for later for some more fun? Chrysalis, Sombra or Discord would not bat an eye. Even her own sister had guilty pleasures. Why was she the only one who was not allowed to have fun? Or then she could just swallow the human here and now – be done with it. Nopony would know. And even if they did, what could they do. She ruled.
1223132.title: She Tosses You Into Her Mouth

12231321.content:
Using her magic Celestia pulls your battered and saliva-soaked body out of her mouth. As you levitate in front of her, you look into one of her gargantuan eyes and try to determine her thoughts towards you. After a moment of deliberation, Celestia finally speaks.

“Tell me little human, how did you like the interior of this royal maw?” She smacks her lips teasingly. “I must admit, I was sorely tempted to just swallow. Would you like that? Sliding down my neck and spending your final moments digesting in my tummy?”

You fervently shake your head. “H-her Highness’s mouth was very w-warm, b-but I would much prefer to remain among the living.”

Celestia gives you a warm smile as she settles her flank onto a rather large cushion. “Are you sure? It’s not every day a princess offers you the opportunity to become one with her.” She levitates you down to her stomach and presses you against it. As you are rubbed up and down against her soft fur, you can hear ominous gurgles coming from within. “Do you hear that? I had a rather delectable slice of cake earlier that is now being churned up in there. You are most welcome to join it.” She levitates you back up to eye level with her. “You could be like one of those little marzipan figures they put on cakes. I could pop you onto my tongue and suckle on you like I just did. Then I would swallow you whole.” Her smile turns most seductive as she brings you to her lips and wraps your body into a kiss.

“Please don’t eat me,” is all you manage to whimper. Celestia chuckles.

“Oh, fret not. You are far too valuable a friend to gobble up. We have barely been introduced. I’m not going to eat you – yet.”

That last yet sends shivers down your spine. Meanwhile, Celestia lowers you to the floor by her hoofs forcing you to pull your head back all the way to see her. She towers over you like a behemoth and the view is made ever more ominous by the way she stares you down.

“Now, allow Us to formally introduce Ourselves. We are Celestia, co-ruler of Equestria and the Princess of the Sun.” She then extends her right hoof into your face which feels like a great boulder rolling towards you. “It is customary for Our subjects to kiss Our hoof when meeting pony-to-pony.”

You hesitate, but an impatient wiggle of the armoured hoof compels you to act. You lean over and plant a small peck against the cold metal. Celestia giggles at your effort. “I suppose that will do. Now, I believe it a good idea to give you a name.”

Your eyes widen. “I already have a n…”

“It should be something cute and easy to remember,” Celestia continues to muse as if she never heard you. “I know. You shall be called Cupcake. My sweet, little Cupcake.”

“Wait! Your Highness, there has been a mistake. I need to get back home,” you desperately call out, but this only prompts Celestia to levitate you back to her lips for another body-encompassing smooch.

“There is no mistake, my little Cupcake. Your home is here with me. I have a vacancy for a chamber colt and you have just been selected for the job. You will address me as your mistress and will obey all of my instructions to the letter. As you can well imagine, an Alicorn of my stature has to deal with crowds of sycophants and the daily rigours of court. As such, I decree that you shall serve me as an object to vent all my frustrations upon. You will fear me, but over time you will come to love me too. Your only right shall be to serve me.”

Celestia levitates you up against her lips and seductively whispers a final taunt, “I cannot promise that you will survive me, but I can promise that you will never see your home again. You are mine to do with as I please.”

With that you are roughly tossed back into the metal cage Celestia had locked you in earlier. The latch shuts with a cold clank and you can do naught, but whimper vain protests at your captor whose enticing smile shines at you through the bars.

“I hope that you have enjoyed my little welcome theatrics. I am afraid that the duties of court await me so I shall ensure that my servants have you looked after. This evening you shall behold as I set the sun to give way to night and then I shall introduce you with my royal nether. I hope you know how to please a mare for I assure you, I am a difficult customer to satisfy. I do have millennia of experience, after all.”

And with that, Celestia withdraws from her quarters, the heavy click of her door’s lock signalling the beginning of your new life as an object of passion and abuse to an immortal Alicorn.
12231321.title: Celestial Service

12231322.content:
For a while longer Celestia suckled on the little human while she mused on all the things she could do with it. She could keep it as her secret plaything. Something to vent all her frustrations on. Then she snapped back to reality before she got carried away.

Bad thoughts Celestia. Bad thoughts.

No. This had been fun, but Celestia knew the risks if she let herself indulge too much in malevolence. It was time to end this and have a stern chat with Luna about conjuring humans to Equestria. However, she would allow herself one more guilty pleasure that would both solve the problem and bring her some devilish joy.

*******

A sudden sensation of being pulled grips your body as light floods into the living cavern and you are dragged along the tongue into the outside world. The air feels cold against your saliva-soaked skin and you find yourself once more levitating in front of the god-like equine. She spins you in the air as her eyes study you with a mischievous twinkle in them.

“I thank you for your service, little one,” she says in a soft, but dominating tone. “I hope you enjoyed yourself as much as I did. It is not every day that one is blessed with a princess’s kiss. Now, I’m afraid that figuring out a way to send you home is simply not practical and letting you go free here in Equestria is not an option at your current stature. Therefore, I decree that you shall remain with me – as fat on my flank.”

This last part she says with a fiendish grin, no doubt fueled by the look of utter horror forming on your face as her implication sinks in. You open your mouth to beg, but your words are caught in your throat as Celestia casts a muffling spell on you.
“Hush, little one. There is nothing you can say or do to deter my will. But fear not, I won’t bite. Merely swallow you. Whole.”

The magical aura levitating you suddenly dissipates resulting in a split-second drop before you abruptly stop as Celestia snatches you by your ankle. This leaves you flailing upside down like a ragdoll right above her divine face.

“Take a good look at me for I am the last thing you will ever see. I may be the Princess of the Sun, but I assure you, it is quite dark inside me.” She parts her lips, fully revealing that fleshy cavern you had been in moments before. This time though, your destination took you past the tongue and right into her throat which she was teasingly flexing for you.

“Down the hatch.”

With that final taunt Celestia releases you, allowing gravity to work its magic on you. In the space of a second you go from floating above the gargantuan horse to crashing headfirst into her gullet while barely scraping against her tongue. The world goes dark as she snaps her jaw shut, but there is a short reprieve as Celestia resists the reflex to swallow. Then a wet GLRK sends you plummeting towards your fate.

You are forcefully kneaded down a suffocating tunnel with the sickening sensation of your face passing through thick mucus. This is a story around a human who wakes up in the world of My Little Pony. He stands now at about an inch tall (The normal ponies stand at about three feet at the shoulder). The human will remained unnamed and is to be written in the second person "You look up. You run for your life. There are also some rules that I want to make sure everyone knows

1) Use proper grammar. It doesn't have to be perfect but it has to be understandable and no text talk!
2) No one line chapters except for when you are choosing what pony the character is going to interact with at the beginning.

8) Please add. Thank you.
